description: From Middle English feuter, fewtre, from Old French feutre, from Medieval Latin filtrum, of Germanic origin. Doublet of filter.

entries.meaning: A support or holder for a spear, attached to a saddle or breastplate.

verbs.description: fewter (third-person singular simple present fewters, present participle fewtering, simple past and past participle fewtered)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To rest (a spear) in its fewter.
